summary: This bill, the Public Safety Officer Concussion and Traumatic Brain Injury Health Act of 2025, mandates that the Secretary of Health and Human Services, through the CDC, collect and disseminate information on concussions and traumatic brain injuries among public safety officers. This includes research on best practices, protective equipment, and medical information. The information is intended for medical professionals, public safety employers, mental health professionals, patients, and researchers. The Secretary is also authorized to support efforts to develop model guidelines and practices for treating these injuries, potentially through grants and cooperative agreements.
